intro: Anisomeris juruensis, commonly known as the Juruense daisy, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant features showy, yellow to orange composite flowers that bloom in spring and early summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Anisomeris juruensis is adapted to grow in sunny, well-drained habitats, often found in grasslands and open forests.
